topics.body:
Ughhh
*thud of my head hitting my desk

You know how fred phelphs died?  Well give up hope of the wbc disbanding cause they have a brand new protest strategy.  They're going to start protesting colleges.


I know that this is getting into religion for a bit, and that belongs to the religion thread, *BUT* considering the rising the percentage of young people(last I checked around a third of people under 20 in the usa aren't christian) that aren't christian this seems to be massively counter productive.  All this is really going to do is cause even more young people to leave christianity.

When you break down their reasons for this they're essentially going, "I don't like how christianity's on decline so I'm going to do something that's going to cause christianity to decline even further!  *GENUIS!*"
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53594ceb6368724c85710000#post_53594ceb6368724c85710000
[bq="uc9"]Ughhh
*thud of my head hitting my desk

You know how fred phelphs died?  Well give up hope of the wbc disbanding cause they have a brand new protest strategy.  They're going to start protesting colleges.


I know that this is getting into religion for a bit, and that belongs to the religion thread, *BUT* considering the rising the percentage of young people(last I checked around a third of people under 20 in the usa aren't christian) that aren't christian this seems to be massively counter productive.  All this is really going to do is cause even more young people to leave christianity.

When you break down their reasons for this they're essentially going, "I don't like how christianity's on decline so I'm going to do something that's going to cause christianity to decline even further!  *GENUIS!*"[/bq]

Did you really fucking think they would disband after him?

They had already replaced him before his death. These past few years he's been more symbolic. His daughter has been running the show ever sense Fred Phelps was getting old. The Westboro Baptist Church isn't going to go away that easy. They've been well aware enough for long enough to get a successor in place.

Phelps had been effectively retired.
topics.author: 4fe4bf947f123b175b000001

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/535953c46368726cdb3e0000#post_535953c46368726cdb3e0000

If you know it's bound to fail, why getting upset?

Let them follow down this path and they will cumbrle down on their own and when they realized what happened they will be too late to do something about it and they will simply be muffled by another movement similar to them. It's the circle of life so to speak.
